qas.question: What European rank was equivalent to that of General of the Army?
On what date did Eisenhower receive his General of the Army appointment?
Along with Montgomery, with whom did Eisenhower disagree on strategy?
What Soviet military leader was a counterpart of Eisenhower?
What rank was held by de Gaulle?

context: In recognition of his senior position in the Allied command, on <a1_0>December 20, 1944<a1_0/>, he was promoted to General of the Army, equivalent to the rank of <a0_0>Field Marshal<a0_0/> in most European armies. In this and the previous high commands he held, Eisenhower showed his great talents for leadership and diplomacy. Although he had never seen action himself, he won the respect of front-line commanders. He interacted adeptly with allies such as Winston Churchill, Field Marshal Bernard Montgomery and <a4_0>General<a4_0/> Charles de Gaulle. He had serious disagreements with <a2_0>Churchill<a2_0/> and Montgomery over questions of strategy, but these rarely upset his relationships with them. He dealt with Soviet Marshal <a3_0>Zhukov<a3_0/>, his Russian counterpart, and they became good friends.
